meanings.definition: To converse casually, especially in order to gain an advantage or make a social connection.
meanings.sent1: At the party, I saw him schmooze with everyone, trying to make new friends.
meanings.sent2: She loves to schmooze with her coworkers during lunch breaks.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to schmooze its way into getting extra treats from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The politician knew how to schmooze the crowd, winning their support effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The salesman could schmooze his customers into buying anything.

meanings.definition: Flattering or ingratiating talk intended to persuade someone.
meanings.sent1: Her constant schmooze with the boss made her colleagues jealous.
meanings.sent2: The success of the deal was largely due to his smooth schmooze with the clients.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's witty schmooze with the audience had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The student's schmooze with the teacher got him an extension on his assignment.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's charming schmooze at the gala impressed all the attendees.
